recommendations.recommendation: It`s not very often that an episodic anime gets my attention, but "Sakamoto Desu ga" manages to be funny and enthralling at the same time without really having much of a plot. Every character has its own moment and I finished every episode wanting more. Be advised, this style of humor is very peculiar, and not everyone will be amused by it.
It was fun. I laughed a lot.

anime.description: The story follows the daily life of the "coolest" high school student, http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto]. As soon as he transfers to his new school, he attracts the attention of not just his class, but the whole student body. His jealous classmates` attempts to bully him repeatedly backfire, and instead make Sakamoto look cooler. Source: ANN

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: absurdist humour
tag.description: Surreal humour, also known as absurdist humour, is a form of humour predicated on deliberate violations of causal reasoning, producing events and behaviours that are obviously illogical. Constructions of surreal humour tend to involve bizarre juxtapositions, non-sequiturs, irrational or absurd situations, and expressions of nonsense. The humour arises from a subversion of audience`s expectations, so that amusement is founded on unpredictability, separate from a logical analysis of the situation. Its appeal stems from the fact that the situation described is exceedingly ridiculous or unlikely. On an analytical level, all jokes contain a certain amount of incongruity, but while regular jokes carry an incongruity that the audience accepts as compatible with expectations, absurd jokes are characterized by a disproportionate amount of it, with the punch line delivering a situation incompatible with the world as we know it and failing to resolve the matter in the audience`s eyes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: bullying
tag.description: Bullying is the use of force, threat, or coercion to abuse, intimidate, or aggressively dominate others. One who engages in bullying is known as a bully. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: nearly almighty protagonist
tag.description: Man 1: "Hey man, did you see me take down that guy over there, there`s no way he could have survived that!" Man 2: "Yeah I know what you mean, it would take the strength of 1 million men to be able to ..... HE`S GETTING BACK UP!!?!?" *synonymous jaws dropping* This anime`s main character is comparable to the gods themselves in terms of resistibility, strength and/or downright bad-assery. Whenever they seem as if the fire inside has burnt out, they rise from the ashes with enough tenacity and ferocity to vanquish any foe that dare stand against them.

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your mouth and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: multi-segment episodes
tag.description: Multi-segment episodes are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes], which are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length (up to and including 10 minutes). Also not to be confused with an OVA or music video with multiple (otherwise unrelated) full-length http://anidb.net/t7241 [bundled episodes] consolidated into a single episode video track.

tag.name: episodic
tag.description: An episodic anime consists of many successive short arcs that are generally 1-2 episodes in length, with strong plot continuity within each arc but generally little continuity from one arc to the next. For long shows (well upwards of 50 episodes), the episode count constraint is less tight; for example, a show with close to 250 episodes would also be considered episodic if it consisted of a majority of arcs of up to 3 or maybe 4 episodes and possibly also very few slightly longer arcs.

tag.name: Crunchyroll Anime Awards
tag.description: Crunchyroll Anime Awards are annual awards given to recognize anime from the previous year. The awards were first held in January 2017. The judges create a short list in different categories and public votes for the winners are held online.

character.name: Sakamoto
character.description: Sakamoto is the protagonist of the series who is a model student for all the other students in his school. He is the perfect man who can solve any problem with a kind, yet unflappable persona. Because of this, many girls fall for him, and some of his male classmates resent him. Although he acts strangely sometimes (such as doing weird poses or acting sneakily), it only adds to his coolness. Sakamoto has a range of `secret skills` which allow him to do various things, such as catch bugs or blow bubbles. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: 8823-senpai
character.description: Hayabusa Shou is a delinquent in 2nd grade who is regarded as a model by other delinquents. He is handsome and smart, and, unlike most delinquents, he respects honor. He managed to drag http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto] into a duel with him, but was finally moved by Sakamoto. He is currently aligned to Sakamoto after long-time delinquent http://anidb.net/ch80875 [Fukase] damaged his noseline during the cultural festival. It reveals that he is the eldest brother who showed concern on his siblings and his estranged http://anidb.net/ch83564 [father]. Hayabusa was the last person that Sakamoto met before he left for America and the former suspected his reason of departure as a lie despite Sakamoto denied it as such. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Maeda Atsushi
character.description: Maeda Atsushi is http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto]`s former bully, and one of a three-member delinquent group. After being bested by Sakamoto, Atsushi no longer smokes, instead choosing to blow bubbles. He harbors both resentment and admiration to Sakamoto. During the third year students` graduation ceremony, he was manipulated into attacking Sakamoto while he delivered a speech. Eventually, he gave up and voiced his jealousy towards Sakamoto and the latter covered up his attack as a part of his speech, saving him from disciplinary punishments. Source: Wikipedia, edited.

character.name: Maruyama-senpai
character.description: Maruyama is a delinquent in 2nd grade who once used http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto] as his errand boy, but Sakamoto`s seemingly considerate "service" finally overwhelmed him. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kubota Yoshinobu
character.description: Kubota Yoshinobu is a student who was being bullied for money until http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto] helped him get a part-time job at WcDonalds. Kubota managed to stand up for himself in dealing with the bullies, and now hangs out with Sakamoto. Like Sakamoto, he has `secret skills`, though they are all related to fast food. He cares for his hair so much, that when http://anidb.net/ch80861 [Hayabusa]`s underclassmen shaves all of his hair until he goes bald, he cries and stays in his room, not wanting to see anyone. He is also seen bringing hair care equipment to school. Source: Wikipedia, edited.

character.name: Kubota Shigemi
character.description: Kubota Shigemi is http://anidb.net/ch80869 [Yoshinobu]`s mother, who fell for http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto] ever since she met him, as he resembles Chon Choriso, her favorite Korean actor. Source: Wikipedia, edited.

character.name: Fukase-san
character.description: Fukase is a long-time delinquent who is in 30`s, has IQ of 180 and had a strange past. He is popular among delinquents due to his tendency of targeting popular students while manipulating others to do his dirty work. He harbors interest to http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto] and decides to play a "game" with him in throwing him out in school during the cultural festival which he is unsuccessful. During the graduation ceremony for the third graders, Fukase manipulates http://anidb.net/ch80862 [Acchan] into attacking Sakamoto but once this fails, he was bested by Sakamoto and the whole school`s delinquents into his own graduation. Finally moved on by Sakamoto, he was never to be shown at the school ever since. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Sera Yuuya
character.description: Sera Yuuya is a male student who is in the same class as http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto]. He disliked him for always stealing the class` attention. Sera was a teenage model until an incident involving Sakamoto and a wasp, and now is a class clown who makes bee jokes. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Tanaka-san
character.description: Tanaka-san is a female student who belongs to http://anidb.net/ch80880 [Aina]`s circle of friends.

character.name: Fujita Megumi
character.description: Fujita Megumi is a female student and the class representative in http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto]`s class. She is fond of taking the photographs of Sakamoto. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kakuta-sensei
character.description: Kakuta is a dark-skinned man who is Class 1-2`s Physical and Health Education teacher. He resents http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto] for his act of coming to school exactly on time before the bell rings, and by sliding in between his legs. His hair has a straight cut so perfect that it can be used as a substitute for a ruler. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kuronuma Aina
character.description: Kuronuma Aina is a female student in http://anidb.net/ch79466 [Sakamoto]`s class who falls for him. She is very popular among boys but has no interest for anyone else except Sakamoto, which makes her disliked by other girls. She charms the boys to do her bidding by making them fall in love with her through `love lessons`, which turned out to be totally invalid to Sakamoto. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 坂本はすけべですか? / 授業風景オムニバス / 坂本が消えた夏
Is Sakamoto a Pervert? / The "Sights of the Classroom" Collection / The Summer Sakamoto Disappeared
Sakamoto wa Sukebe Desuka? / Jugyou Fuukei Omnibus / Sakamoto ga Kieta Natsu
episode.summary: Kakuta-sensei, the guidance counselor, keeps an eye out for Sakamoto at the school gate every morning. But every day, Sakamoto arrives at the last possible minute and uses all kinds of tricks to slip through the gate in time, much to Kakuta-sensei`s chagrin. Now he`s determined to find Sakamoto`s weak point and scold him until he can`t even stand up straight... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パシリスト坂本 / 恋のかくれんぼ
Errand Boy Sakamoto / Love Hide-and-Seek
Pasilist Sakamoto / Koi no Kakurenbo
episode.summary: A second-year delinquent, Maruyama, has been making first-years into his errand boys. Sakamoto becomes one of them, and Maruyama is more than pleased with his work. Eventually he grows bored of coming up with orders and tells Sakamoto to serve him of his own volition! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 守られるより守りたい / 今日から使える恋愛心理術
I`d Rather Protect Than Be Protected / Psychological Techniques for Romance That You Can Use Today
Mamorareru yori Mamoritai / Kyou kara Tsukaeru Ren`ai Shinri Jutsu
episode.summary: One day, Sakamoto sees his classmate, Kubota, being shaken down. He calls out to him, and Kubota begs for his help, saying he has no money left. But Sakamoto has an idea... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 1年2組 坂本君 / ビー・クワイエット
Class 1-2, Sakamoto-kun / Bee Quiet
Sakamoto, de la seconde 2 / Bee Quiet
1 Nen 2 Kumi Sakamoto-kun / Bee Quiet
episode.summary: Sakamoto is a stylish student whose cool behavior draws the attention of everyone at his high school. Three punks in his class who don`t like him, Acchan, Mario, and Kenken, target him for all sorts of bullying, but it always backfires on them. So they finally decide to take care of him for real... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
Opening
文化祭はグルーミー
A Gloomy Cultural Festival
Bunkasai wa Gloomy
episode.summary: Sakamoto and the rest of Class 1-2 are preparing for the cultural festival. But some students lack the motivation to work since the class is only setting up a display, leaving the class rep, Fujita, at a loss. Meanwhile, the delinquent boys are having fun preparing for the festival when they`re approached by Fukase, a third-year delinquent who frightens even Hayabusa and his gang... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やはり坂本はすけべですか? / 瀬良のフランス革命
Really, Is Sakamoto a Pervert? / Sera`s French Revolution
Yahari Sakamoto wa Sukebe Desuka? / Sera no France Kakumei
episode.summary: One day finds Acchan, Kenken, and Mario in the video rental store. They have only one goal: to get into the 18+ section, rent their films of choice, and make the leap into watching porn! But the gate that separates them from the adult realm (the curtain to the 18+ section) is thick, and they can`t seem to break through. Just then, Sakamoto strolls into the scene! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 下校のルール / カメラ越しの恋 / 食堂マーケティング
Rules for Leaving School / Love Through the Camera Lens / Cafeteria Marketing
Gekou no Rule / Camera-goshi no Koi / Shokudou Marketing
episode.summary: Kicking rocks, walking on a white line... Sakamoto makes even looks stylish playing such silly after-school games. Three young boys see him and follow him, undaunted. Despite their initial sense of rivalry, the boys find themselves increasingly drawn to Sakamoto... when suddenly, an obstacle stands in their path! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ソフトボール投げ / カリスマヤンキー8823先輩 / 健康管理
Softball Throw / The Charismatic Delinquent, Hayabusa-senpai / Personal Health Care
Softball Nage / Charisma Yankee 8823-senpai / Kenkoukanri
episode.summary: Maruyama still hasn`t recovered from the trauma he experienced when Sakamoto was his personal errand boy. As he watches Maruyama tremble in fear at the mere sight of Sakamoto, Hayabusa-senpai, fellow delinquent and head of the second-years, challenges Sakamoto to fight one-on-one! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さよなら坂本君
Goodbye, Sakamoto-kun
Sayonara Sakamoto-kun
episode.summary: It`s the day of the graduation ceremony. As Sakamoto is giving the farewell address to the third-years, Acchan suddenly storms the stage and attacks him with a bat... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ぬくもりはいらない / 1-2メモリーズ
I Don`t Need Warmth / Class 1-2 Memories
Nukumori wa Iranai / 1-2 Memories
episode.summary: Snow blankets the ground in town for the first time in several years. Sakamoto has never seen accumulated snow before, so Acchan declares he`ll teach him how to play in snow, but Sakamoto easily masters everything Acchan tries to teach him. Acchan is frustrated as his attempts to face Sakamoto on even footing fail, so Fukase tells him that if he wants to be on even footing, then he must fight Sakamoto one-on-one... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔王 / 足りないもの
The Devil / What`s Lacking
Maou / Tarinai Mono
episode.summary: On Christmas night, Sakamoto meets a college guy by chance and ends up being invited to a mixer with three guys and three girls... but Sakamoto doesn`t know the first thing about mixers! What sort of cool behavior will he be able to display at his first ever mixer?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 坂本君と私の出会い / 一番近くて遠い人
How Sakamoto-kun and I Met / The One Closest to Me, Yet Most Distant
Sakamoto-kun to Watashi no Deai / Ichiban Chikakute Tooi Hito
episode.summary: Fujita, Mii-chan, and Kana-chan are eating lunch outside when they see Sakamoto juggling with piping hot meat buns. As they watch him in fascination, Fujita begins to tell the romantic story of her first meeting with Sakamoto, followed by Mii-chan and Kana-chan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 坂本でした?
Haven`t You Heard? I Was Sakamoto
Sakamoto Deshita?
episode.summary: Just who is Sakamoto? He`s enigmatic. He`s clever. He`s dashing. No challenge is too great and no cause is too small for Sakamoto. Girls love him, guys hate him for it, and despite efforts to humiliate him, Sakamoto is flawlessly able to emerge from the fray, even cooler than ever. Who knows what Sakamoto is going to do next? Whatever it is, it will be fabulous! Source: crunchyroll
